text: this is Bill Cunningham on the fashion
front in New York City and as the New
Year blossoms
sure enough the fashion world has gone
back to find the future if you will but
this time they didn't go to the 20s or
30s they went way back to the Middle
Ages late 13th century 14th century and
the early Renaissance the inspiration I
think at least to my eyes looked like
the quote courtiers the men of these
periods I saw a woman with a little
jacket right out of the period think of
Romeo and Juliet and Romeo and the
jacket would have been rate for Romeo
except it's the women have adapted it
today and it's all in black doublet
jacket tights whichever way you want
it's a silhouette is all there in the
medieval time and the Renaissance of
course it was the same similar
silhouette but it was all in stained
glass jeweled colors so the big
difference everything about it big
sleeves the cartridge quilted body of
the jacket the flare and worn with very
narrow towers
if there's no question that fashion goes
back and then reinvents itself into the
future it's really fascinating and as we
enter the kind of gloomy short days of
winter what could be better than to go
to the cloister Museum the branch of the
Metropolitan and just wallow in the art
effects and architecture and paintings
and tapestries of the Middle Ages and
the Renaissance
